p: Seven-day-old female adults were fed on a blood meal containing 1.4 mL of washed rabbit red blood cells and 0.7 mL of viral suspension (Table 1). The blood meal was supplemented with ATP as a phagostimulant at a final concentration of 1 mM. Mosquitoes were exposed to the blood using a Hemotek® membrane feeding system. Virus titers of blood meals were at 10 7 ffu/mL for CHIKV and DENV, and 10 7 pfu/ml for ZIKV. Engorged mosquitoes were transferred into boxes and fed ad libitum with 10% sucrose solution. Mosquitoes were maintained under a photoperiod of 12:12, at 28 °C until analysis.
